summaryText: In this powerful sermon, Pastor Scott Williams delivers a compelling message about the importance of 'checking your baggage' - both literally and metaphorically. Using a humorous travel analogy, he breaks down how we often carry unnecessary emotional and spiritual weight that prevents us from experiencing God's best for our lives. Scott explains that we all carry something - whether it's regret, hurt, worry, or pain - and challenges us to dig deep, take inventory, and ultimately give our burdens to God. Can you imagine how freeing it would be to stop lugging around past hurts and disappointments? Scott reminds us that God isn't concerned about what happens TO us, but what happens THROUGH us. He uses the biblical story of Saul hiding behind baggage to illustrate how our past can hold us back from God's incredible plans. The sermon is a powerful call to action: determine what you're carrying, inventory what needs to be let go, and then give it all to God. Through personal stories and relatable examples, Scott shows that when we 'check our baggage' with God, He promises to carry our burdens and prevent us from slipping and falling. It's an invitation to travel light, spiritually speaking, and trust that God has something amazing in store for us!
mainPoints: Determine what emotional and spiritual baggage you are carrying
Take inventory of what you need to let go

versesMentioned.text: But though I have rescued you from your misery and distress, you have rejected your God today and have said, 'No, we want a king instead.' Now therefore present yourselves before the Lord by tribes and clans.
Give your burdens to the Lord, and he will take care of you. He will not permit the godly to slip and fall.
I regret that I have made Saul king, for he has turned away from me and has not carried out my instructions.

Monday.scripture: Philippians 3:13-14: 'Brothers and sisters, I do not consider myself yet to have taken hold of it. But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.'
Monday.action: Create a physical 'baggage release' journal. Write down one piece of emotional baggage you've been carrying and symbolically 'release' it to God by praying over the page and then safely discarding it.
Monday.prayer: God, help me to release the weights I've been carrying. Show me the burdens that are holding me back from Your best plans for my life. Give me the courage to let go and trust You completely. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Matthew 11:28-30: 'Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest. Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls. For my yoke is easy and my burden is light.'
Tuesday.action: Spend 15 minutes in quiet reflection. Identify one area of worry or stress and consciously 'hand it over' to God through prayer.
Tuesday.prayer: Jesus, I'm tired of carrying these burdens alone. I surrender my worries to You. Teach me what it means to truly rest in Your peace. Replace my anxiety with Your calm. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Isaiah 43:18-19: 'Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past. See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.'
Wednesday.action: Make a list of personal dreams or goals you've abandoned. Pray over each one, asking God to renew your vision or redirect your path.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, I release my old, limited perspectives. Open my eyes to the new opportunities You're creating. Give me faith to trust Your guidance and vision for my life. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Thursday.action: Identify one negative habit or thought pattern. Create a practical strategy to replace it with a positive, God-honoring alternative.
Thursday.prayer: Father, transform my mind and heart. Help me recognize the old patterns that no longer serve me and empower me to walk in the newness of life You've given me. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Friday.action: Write a letter to yourself from God's perspective, highlighting His love, promises, and hope for your future.
Friday.prayer: God, help me trust Your plans even when I can't see the full picture. Replace my fear with faith and my doubt with confidence in Your goodness. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Ephesians 4:31-32: 'Get rid of all bitterness, rage and anger, brawling and slander, along with every form of malice. Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.'
Saturday.action: Identify one relationship where you're holding onto past hurt. Take a step towards forgiveness, whether through prayer, a conversation, or releasing the pain to God.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, give me the strength to forgive as You have forgiven me. Help me release any bitterness or resentment and walk in Your freedom and grace. Amen.
